parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example to get all upload jobs the expression would be where=job_direction='UPLOAD'. The following fields are valid search fields 'object_name', 'job_status', 'job_direction', 'record_count'
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Fetch all the bulk jobs for an instance

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Url to send the notification to when the Job is completed
parameters.name: Elements-Async-Callback-Url

parameters.description: The CEQL query. When this parameter is omitted, all objects of the given type are returned via the bulk job. Endpoint limiters may still apply.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The last time this query was run. This is optional. You can also have this parameter in the query and leave this blank - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: lastRunDate

parameters.description: The created/updated date of the object to filter on - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The created/updated date of the object to filter on - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Optional JSON MetaData that contains callback-payload, ex: {"callback-payload" : <Json> }. callback-payload - is passed back in bulk job notification
parameters.name: metaData

get.summary: Retrieve the results of an asynchronous bulk query.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Url to send the notification to when the Job is completed
parameters.name: Elements-Async-Callback-Url

parameters.description: The name of the object for which data needs to be uploaded.
parameters.name: objectName

parameters.description: Optional JSON MetaData that contains callback-payload, path or format, ex: {"path" : <path for the sub resource>, "format": <json/csv>, "callback-payload":<json>}. path - is passed to the endpoint for bulk loading the data into a nested object. Optional JSON Metadata that contains identifierFieldName, action, listId or campaignId. The identifierField name is used for upserts and the optional fields like listId or campaignId. Example: {"listId":"1014","action":"upsert"}. If the Upload format is JSON pass metadata as {"format":"json"}. callback-payload - is passed back in bulk job notification
parameters.name: metaData

parameters.description: The file of objects to bulk load. If the JSON file upload, each JSON record should be in a single line
parameters.name: file

get.summary: Get all campaigns in an account

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. fields Array - A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation. exclude_fields Array - A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation. type - Array - The campaign type. (regular, plaintext, absplit, rss, variate) status - Array - The status of the campaign. (save, paused, schedule, sending, sent) before_send_time String - Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00. since_send_time String - Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00. before_create_time String - Restrict the response to campaigns created before the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00. since_create_time String - Restrict the response to campaigns created after the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00. list_id String - The unique id for the list.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size. Defaults to 100 if not provided. Maximum of 2000
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Search for contacts for a list

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The list ID.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. fields Array - A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation. exclude_fields Array - A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation. email_type String - The email type. status String - The subscribers status. since_timestamp_opt String - Restrict results to subscribers who opted-in after the set timeframe. before_timestamp_opt String - Restrict results to subscribers who opted-in before the set timeframe. since_last_changed String - Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed after the set timeframe. before_last_changed String - Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed before the set timeframe. unique_email_id String - A unique identifier for the email address across all MailChimp lists. This parameter can be found in any links with Ecommerce 360 tracking enabled.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size. Defaults to 100 if not provided. Maximum of 5000
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description:
The CEQL search expression, format parameter = 'value'. Available Options:
fields (Array) = A comma-separated list of fields to return.
exclude_fields (Array) = A comma-separated list of fields to exclude.
type (Array) = The campaign type. Possible Values: regular, plaintext, absplit, rss, variate.
before_send_time (String) = Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.
since_send_time (String) = Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time, ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records to return.
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`

parameters.name: fields

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

job_query.x-samplevalue: SELECT attributes.organizationid, attributes.systemuserid, organizationid FROM users WHERE organizationid = '3b80f68d-b945-4208-9442-f55bd0e1c5b2'

instanceId.description: Instance Id of the bulk job

description.x-samplevalue: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

from_names.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

subject_lines.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

description.x-samplevalue: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.

from_name.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate and no from_names are provided.

reply_to.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate and no reply_to_addresses are provided.

subject_line.x-conditionally-required-description: Require when type is variate and no subject lines are provided.
